item.title: Linux keyboard input
item.description: This article explain how keyboard events are emits from hardware and delivered to userspace applications. Overview Keyboard hareware sends scancode to kernel. Kernel translates scancode to keycode. keyboard layout defines the mapping from (keycode, modifiers...) tuple to keysym, which is either a printable character, or an action to carry out (e.g. volumn up /down/reboot). character set (or charset) assigns each keysym symbol a specific number. key composition: in some language, typing 2 keys on the keyboard should produce a single accented letter.
